page.title: 01THE GRIBBEN BEACON
page.content: { This headland has sea around three sides and is called the Gribbin.It has lots of small coves and little beaches.When the tide goes out you can explore more of the coastline and uncover new and interesting things.Some of the land is owned by the National Trust.The cliffs are about 70 metres high.The Gribbin Beacon is all man made and has some writing just above the door explaining it's purpose and erection by Trinity House. The Beacon is a red and white striped tower which is about 25 metres high.It was built as a guide to shipping coming into Fowey over 100 years ago. Saint Catherine's Castle is a ruined fort,built in the reign of Henry the Eighth.Most of the stone walls are still standing.
